description:
We are seeking an experienced Technical Product Manager with a strong background in Electronic Medical Records (EMR), design thinking, and technical expertise. This role requires experience in project management and a commitment to quality and adept at leading cross-functional teams. The role will oversee the full product implementation lifecycle, ensuring that system testing, and support processes meet industry standards, compliance requirements, and client expectations.

This role is onsite in our New York offices.

Responsibilities:
• Internal Client and Stakeholder Management
• Act as the main client liaison, gathering client requirements to turn them into actionable work items.
• Lead regular project updates to keep clients informed about progress, testing outcomes, and support metrics.
• Build strong client relationships, providing transparent communication and managing expectations effectively.
• End-to-End Planning and Execution
• Create and maintain roadmap in alignment with business priorities and expectations
• Design project plans that cover deliverables, timelines, testing protocols, and resource allocation.
• Set milestones for each project phase, from requirements gathering till product launch.
• Closely monitor timelines, adjusting plans as needed to address technical challenges or evolving requirements.
• Team Leadership and Knowledge Development
• Support cross-functional Agile teams, ensuring alignment on roles for development, testing, and support.
• Thorough knowledge of systems integrations via REST or other protocols, UI/UX toolsets.
• Good understanding of front end and backend systems design and data management, data engineering
• Guide system testing protocols, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
• Conduct regular team meetings, fostering skill development and performance recognition.
• System Testing and Quality Assurance Management
• Oversee a structured approach to testing, including unit, integration, regression, performance, and end-to-end tests.
• Work with QA engineers to design comprehensive test cases that cover functionality and edge cases.
• Review testing outcomes, addressing defects to ensure all issues are resolved before delivery.
• Smoke test results with every deployment
• Technical Support and Issue Resolution
• Manage a technical support framework to ensure effective issue resolution, with escalation paths for complex problems.
• Manage the issue tracking process, from identification through to resolution, and conduct root cause analysis to prevent recurrence.
• Oversee post-implementation technical support to ensure a smooth transition for clients and address any ongoing needs.
• Continue to groom the backlog with identified technical improvements
• Documentation and Reporting
• Maintain thorough project documentation, covering requirements, testing results, and support cases to ensure compliance.
• Manage progress reports that capture project health, testing metrics, and support activities for stakeholders.
• Ensure documentation is accurate and accessible for audits or future reference.
• Continuous Improvement and Innovation
• Use insights from Agile retrospectives and support metrics to drive process improvements.
• Research and implement best practices in system testing and support, increasing efficiency and client satisfaction.
• Foster a culture of innovation and encourage team contributions to process enhancements.

Required Qualifications:

Experience:
• 5+ years of product management experience with a focus on EMR systems, system testing, and technical support.
• Proven success in managing large-scale IT projects that prioritize quality assurance and support.
• Experience in healthcare technology, with a strong understanding of compliance standards.

Technical Expertise:
• Expertise in EMR platforms, data integration, and healthcare compliance (e.g., HIPAA, OSHA).
• Skilled with project management tools (e.g., JIRA, Asana), testing tools (e.g., Selenium, TestRail), and support systems (e.g., Zendesk, ServiceNow).
• Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and incident management best practices

Leadership and Communication Skills:
• Effective team leadership with the ability to drive collaboration, motivate performance, and resolve conflicts.
• Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
• Strong communication skills for managing client relations, directing teams, and detailed documentation.

Preferred Qualifications:
• PMP, Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), PMI-ACP, or similar certifications.
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Healthcare Management, Information Systems, or related fields.
• Experience with EMR-related performance metrics, troubleshooting techniques, and data analytics.

Other Key Attributes / Talent Characteristics:
• Team player with good interpersonal skills
• Organized Individual with excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
• A strong problem solver with excellent troubleshooting skills

Travel:

5% Travel Requirement - Travel required to stadiums, offsite meetings / events, business partners

Terms /Expected Hours of Work:

NFL employees are required to work 40 hours per week. Indicate whether the role will require overtime (time worked more than 40 hours) and/or weekends. Note* If your position will work under 30 hours per week, they should be part-time. FLSA** If an employee will be paid hourly, they will be non-exempt, and if they are paid a salary, they are exempt.

Salary / Pay Range

This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials, or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.

Salary

$100,000-$135,000 USD

The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.

The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

WHO WE ARE:

NFL Core Values:
• Respect: Everyone matters. We celebrate diverse opinions, honor hard work, and value every contribution.
• Integrity: We do what's right, even when it's tough. We hold ourselves accountable and always follow through.
• Team Responsibility: We support each other and our communities. No one is bigger than the game, and every action impacts others.
• Resiliency: We set high standards, overcome adversity, and adapt to challenges, always striving for excellence.

NFL Leadership Attributes:
• Build Talent: We develop and nurture potential, empowering individuals to grow and succeed.
• Execute: We take action with precision, delivering results that drive our goals forward.
• Inspire: We motivate others through vision, energy, and a commitment to excellence.
• Live Our Values: We embody our core principles in every decision and action.
• Know the Business: We stay informed, understand our industry, and make decisions that strengthen our position.
• Think Big: We challenge the status quo, envision bold possibilities, and strive for transformative impact

WHO YOU ARE:

Talent Attributes: What we expect for our employees:
• Embody an enthusiastic, proactive can-do attitude
• Embrace grit, free from ego or entitlement
• Excel as a relationship builder, with the ability to influence
• Eager learner, driven by passion rather than just ambition
• Encompasses an incredible work ethic with an agile mindset

title: Technical Product Manager (EMR)

description:
About this role

Product Manager, BlackRock AI

The Product Manager for Aladdin AI will be responsible for setting a clear AI Product Strategy with our Aladdin business partners and delivering cohesive AI experiences for Aladdin clients & the firm. They will be responsible for enabling teams to deliver against this strategy in an accelerated, safe and managed way.

Success looks like integrating AI across Aladdin and surrounding workflows to improve the client servicing experience and deliver unmatched value to clients through productivity and efficiency gains.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become ubiquitous within technology and will be core to our strategy to advance our firm. We believe it will transform the investment process and is critical to BlackRock staying competitive.  This team will sit at the forefront of development for AI solutions within Aladdin to unlock sizable value, scale, and opportunity for our clients.

As the product manager for Client Sales and Servicing, your chief responsibility will be setting the vision & strategy for AI products to improve the client experience and working with teams across the firm to deliver against that strategy. You will be responsible for executing on the product roadmap that enables us to achieve that vision and effectively balances priorities across the firm. You will be responsible for working with Sales leads to conceptualize a cohesive AI experience to do their jobs more efficiently & effectively. You’ll partner with the Aladdin AI product management team to prioritize shared solutions & lead product increment planning, enabling us to deliver on our objectives.

Your insights and ability to drive our product forward will help our team deliver world-class AI capabilities and a superb experience for clients. We recognize that strength comes from diversity, and will embrace your unique skills, curiosity, and passion while giving you the opportunity to grow technically and as an individual!

Key Responsibilities:
• Build a cohesive & robust Sales and Servicing experience. Articulate strategy for building AI tools & features within Aladdin to improve both the client experience and user productivity.
• Conceptualize and communicate a product vision for the client experience, identifying key opportunities and product solutions to leverage AI. Set clear path for adoption.
• Educate and evangelize product value internally with senior stakeholders and externally while developing and managing key product relationships.
• Actively shape the AI strategy with business teams across Aladdin. Set the standards & processes for adoption, development, and releasing of AI solutions.
• Partner with Aladdin product team to prioritize initiatives across Aladdin to achieve product strategy and work with Aladdin product teams to deliver against firmwide roadmap. Establish critical partnerships across the central & federated teams and lead product increments to ensure delivery on set objectives and key results.
• Support the prioritization of the backlog and work with team to mitigate development blockers and define deployment strategy across firm.
• Deeply understand the end-to-end processes across the Aladdin to identify opportunities to evolve the product. Lead user research and actively engage with investment community to acquire feedback that influences product roadmap and improves product value.
• Stay up to date on the fast-evolving artificial intelligence space, keeping ahead of trends, and competitive financial capabilities in the fast-evolving AI landscape, ultimately influencing product offering and strategy.

For New York, NY Only the salary range for this position is USD$162,500.00 - USD$215,000.00 . Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, and benefits including heath care, leave benefits, and retirement benefits. BlackRock operates a pay-for-performance compensation philosophy and your total compensation may vary based on role, location, and firm, department and individual performance.

Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Our hybrid work model

BlackRock’s hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person – aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.

About BlackRock

At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.

This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

For additional information on BlackRock, please visit @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock

BlackRock is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees, and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. View the EEOC’s Know Your Rights poster and its supplement and the pay transparency statement.

BlackRock is committed to full inclusion of all qualified individuals and to providing reasonable accommodations or job modifications for individuals with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation/adjustments are needed throughout the employment process, please email Disability.Assistance@blackrock.com. All requests are treated in line with our privacy policy.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

description:
Bloomberg's CTO Office is the future-looking technical and product arm of Bloomberg L.P. We envision, design, and prototype the next generation infrastructure, hardware, and applications for the Bloomberg Terminal. Our projects include machine learning-powered products, cloud computing infrastructure and strategy, open source stewardship, generative AI, and more. We are passionate about what we do.

For more than a decade, Bloomberg has been a trailblazer in its application of AI, Machine Learning (ML), and Natural Language Processing (NLP) in finance. We build models and systems that power sentiment analysis, classification, question answering, document understanding, recommendation, and more, using state of the art AI techniques including generative AI. Critical to this effort are our AI platforms, which enable teams to rapidly and robustly develop, deploy and maintain AI products and features.

What's in it for you
We are looking for a Technical Product Manager to shape and execute the vision and roadmap for our generative AI application development lifecycle. As a product manager, you will focus on the end-to-end user experience, share ownership of the product roadmap for our AI Platforms, and build out new features, capabilities, and integrations to fulfill our mission. You'll be making decisions on how to streamline the AI developer workflow. You will work in a group of other highly motivated product managers that work on a range of adjacent projects around AI application development. You will interact very closely with internal stakeholders from product, engineering, and UX. This is a high-leverage role in a very cross-functional environment, so you'll need to be comfortable wearing many hats and balancing technical expertise with business acumen.

We'll trust you to
- Develop a long-term technical strategy, roadmap, framework, design patterns, tools for improving the developer experience for AI applications
- Partner closely with AI product and engineering teams to accelerate their critical projects, with a focus on generative AI applications
- Interact with internal users and diverse group of partners to understand their workflows and technical requirements, and develop a deep understanding of an ideal user experience
- Foster a culture of collaboration with your Engineering and UX counterparts
- Prioritize, plan, make decisions, ask the right questions, and understand how to plan for and manage resources effectively
- Take the initiative, be proactive, be inclusive, innovate, advocate, understand the priorities for the business, and do what's best for Bloomberg

You'll need to have
-5+ years of experience in technical product management
-Experience working with developer teams and productionizing AI or other data-intensive applications
-Breadth of knowledge or familiarity with GenAI platforms, MLOps platforms, AI toolkits
-Deep understanding of software development best practices
-Organizational and communication skills to effectively coordinate and work with engineers, UX, subject matter experts, other product managers, and senior management
-A product-driven focus and track record of shaping business strategy and roadmaps for technical products

We'd love to see
-A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, HCI, AI, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
-Applied experience with AI, Machine Learning, familiarity with large language models and their operational requirements
-Experience with Distributed Systems, Kubernetes, container orchestration, cloud computing platforms, experience with public cloud providers such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
-Open source involvement or community presence

Senior Technical Program Manager, AdvertisingJob ID: 2742762 | Amazon.com Services LLCWe're looking for entrepreneurial, innovative individuals who thrive on solving tough problems. We are investing in a deep technical team to pursue a transformation opportunity around advertising identity. The successful candidate will build upon technical skills and core program management successes.A Technical Program Manager (TPM) will partner with engineers, other TPMs, Product Managers and senior management to help create world-class solutions. We're looking for people who are passionate about innovating on behalf of customers, demonstrate a high degree of product ownership, and want to have fun while they make history. The ideal TPM is a creative, demonstrated leader with superior analytical abilities and an expeditious drive to deliver results. description:
Job Title: Product Manager

Location: Hybrid NYC (Financial District) – 2 days/onsite

Full time

No C2C inquiries, please.*

Our client is a fast-growing, Y Combinator-backed startup transforming the logistics and freight industry with innovative technology solutions.

As a Product Manager, you will be instrumental in developing and executing product strategy, working at the intersection of logistics, automation, and AI-driven solutions. You’ll collaborate with engineering, design, and business teams to build tools that optimize freight spend management, automate invoice processing, and enhance financial and operational audits. This is an exciting opportunity for a problem-solver who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment and has experience working with complex data-driven systems.

Requirements
• 6+ years of experience in product management
• Background in logistics, shipping, or freight management preferred.
• Experience working on 0-to-1 product development in a high-growth setting.
• Knowledge of AI applications in shipping/trucking logistics is highly valued.

Responsibilities
• Define and execute product strategy, prioritizing features that align with business goals.
• Lead initiatives focused on AP/AR automation and financial audit enhancements.
• Conduct user research and analyze data to identify pain points and validate product ideas.
• Develop and maintain detailed product requirements and user stories.
• Work cross-functionally with engineering, design, sales, and operations to ensure seamless product development.
• Conduct user testing and iterate based on feedback to continuously improve the product.
• Manage multiple product initiatives and communicate progress to stakeholders.

Compensation & Benefits
• Competitive salary ($130K–$180K base) + bonus + equity.
• Additional benefits will be discussed further down the process

title: Product Manager/NYC/Hybrid

description:
About this role

PMG Tech - Investment Platform Team (IPT), Associate

Who we are

PMG Tech Platform is responsible for delivering the Power of the Platform: central capabilities to accelerate tech and research solutions, drive innovation, and build a tech community.

Within PMG Tech, the Investment Platform Team (IPT) focuses on delivering high impact Platform Change for Investments & Trading: partnering with investors and traders and playing a critical role in developing the investment and operating platform. The team combines strategy, business process, and technology expertise to maximize growth, scale, and operating consistency across Investments, with a strong focus on Aladdin.

Projects often span people, process, technology and product. We also work with senior technology, investment and business management partners to define and lead platform strategy, ensuring the platform continues to evolve with the key priorities of BlackRock’s investment teams.

What you will be doing

This role is primarily passionate about the following key areas:
• Work across the globe, managing strategic initiatives that improve the investment operating platform
• Help create solutions to complex problem statements, including regulatory changes, new instrument or product launches, macro events, to name a few
• Assist with business process reviews, use a data driven approach to solve sophisticated problems & influence solutions
• Engage with our Aladdin Partners to help identify innovative solutions, build new Aladdin functionality and unlock insights to influence further advance of the platform
• Navigate and connect the dots across the firm to ensure efficiency, scalability and risk management
• Define, handle and execute platform strategy together with Investment COOs and leadership teams

We are looking for someone who
• Has a BA/BS from an accredited university
• 2+ years’ work experience in financial services, FinTech, and/or order/trade management systems preferable
• Enjoys a challenge and is curious about how things work
• Is comfortable navigating a sometimes-steep learning curve while gaining subject matter expertise
• Is a great teammate, is open and exudes positivity in a group setting
• Has excellent communication skills and a “get the job done” mentality
• Brings knowledge of the capital markets, asset classes, financial instruments (equities, fixed income and derivatives) beneficial
• Ability to navigate life of a trade from both a business and technology view
• Aladdin knowledge and proficiency in technology (SQL, Tableau, Python) a plus

For San Francisco, CA and New York, NY Only the salary range for this position is USD$125,000.00 - USD$155,000.00 . Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, and benefits including heath care, leave benefits, and retirement benefits. BlackRock operates a pay-for-performance compensation philosophy and your total compensation may vary based on role, location, and firm, department and individual performance.

Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Our hybrid work model

BlackRock’s hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person – aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.

About BlackRock

At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.

This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

For additional information on BlackRock, please visit @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock

BlackRock is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees, and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. View the EEOC’s Know Your Rights poster and its supplement and the pay transparency statement.

BlackRock is committed to full inclusion of all qualified individuals and to providing reasonable accommodations or job modifications for individuals with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation/adjustments are needed throughout the employment process, please email Disability.Assistance@blackrock.com. All requests are treated in line with our privacy policy.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

title: Investment Platform Team - Project Manager - Associate

description:
Outreach is the first and only AI Sales Execution Platform built for intelligent revenue workflows. Built on the world’s largest foundation of customer interactions and go-to-market team data, Outreach’s leading revenue AI technology helps go-to-market professionals and their companies win by intelligently accelerating decision making and elevating sellers to do their best work. Our powerful platform gives revenue teams the tools they need to design, measure, and improve a revenue strategy for every stage of the customer journey, improving efficiency and effectiveness across the entire revenue cycle. Over 6,000 customers, including Zoom, McKesson, Snowflake, SAP, and Okta use Outreach to power workflows, put customers at the center of their business, improve revenue results, and win in the market.

Outreach is a privately held company based in Seattle, Washington, with offices worldwide. To learn more, please visit www.outreach.io.

About the Team

At Outreach, Business Systems’ mission is to enable and enhance corporate processes at scale. We are a centralized team providing a suite of services to other Outreachers, helping them to efficiently serve our customers and each other. We are building the team around strong critical thinkers - individuals who can navigate ambiguity and help us along our journey of discovery and transformation.

The Role

As a member of the Business Systems team, you’ll guide our cloud-first architecture, and shape the way we think about corporate systems, cross-platform integrations, and data delivery.

Day-to-day, you will work closely with cross-functional partners in Product, Engineering, Finance, Analytics, Customer Experience and Marketing. You’ll manage gathering requirements, identifying solutions, and assessing fit including build vs. buy decisions, and program execution. A key success factor will be your ability to deliver business process capabilities that seamlessly span systems boundaries by taking ownership to understand the business processes and needs, rather than just approaching your role from a technical perspective.

Location: This position can be in hybrid in Seattle or remote within the US (prefer PT time zone).

Your Daily Adventures Will Include
• Work closely with Product Management, Engineering, and other cross-functional teams to develop and execute strategic technical program plans aligned with business objectives.
• Lead delivery of large, complex, multi-disciplinary projects, and own the program schedules, including prioritization, mobilizing teams, tracking milestones, managing risks and dependencies, and ensuring successful delivery of business and customer outcomes.
• Work cross functionally with different technical and non-technical stakeholders to identify, translate high-level, ambiguous business goals into working software solutions and document requirements.
• Work with teams to streamline processes, address operational inefficiencies, and manage key objectives, ensuring timely releases and optimizing tools for greater efficiency.
• Partner with Product and Corporate Engineering teams to define best practices for scope management, expectation setting, and delivery processes, aligning with internal customer needs.
• Utilize technical acumen to provide insights, support decision-making, and help mitigate risks in collaboration with product and engineering partners.
• Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities.
Our Vision Of You
• 6+ years of experience as a Product Manager, Technical Program Manager, Software Engineer, or related role in a cloud-first environment.
• B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience.
• Strong program management skills with technical and business acumen.
• Experience leading cross-functional delivery across application boundaries, collaborating with both systems and software engineers in build+buy scenarios.
• Skilled in roadmap planning, scoping, and discovery for large cross-company initiatives, with expertise in defining and documenting requirements, tracking progress, resolving dependencies, and communicating status to stakeholders and leadership.
• Ability to navigate ambiguity, manage competing priorities, and drive execution in dynamic environments, while taking ownership and identifying key opportunities for organizational transformation.
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills, with a consultative approach.
• Strong ability to prioritize, assess risks, and evaluate trade-offs to drive optimal outcomes.
• Understanding of technical architecture, data delivery, and integration, with familiarity in modern programming languages.
• Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage across all levels, including technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• You embody our core values: We are hungry craftspeople, we have grit, we are honest, we take ownership, we have each other's back no matter what, we're one with our customers, and we find strength in diversity and inclusion.

$135,000 - $160,000 a year

The base salary range for this role is $135,000-$160,000 USD. You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. We also have a location-based compensation structure; there may be a different range for candidates in other locations.

#LI-SC1

#LI-Hybrid

#LI-Remote

Why You’ll Love It Here

• Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees and their dependents

• Flexible time off

• 401k to help you save for the future

• Diversity and inclusion programs that promote employee resource groups like OWN+ (Outreach Women's Network), Adelante (Latinx community), OBX (Outreach Black Connection), Mosaic (AAPI community), Pride (LGBTQIA+), Gender+, Disability Community, and Veterans/Military

• A parental leave program that includes not just extended time off but options for a paid night nurse, and a gradual return to work

• Infertility/ assisted reproductive services benefit

• Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team

• Plus, unlimited snacks and beverages in our kitchen

• We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

Our success is reliant on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can elevate assumptions and ideas with fresh perspectives. We're dedicated to hiring the whole human, not just a resume. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants-including those from historically marginalized groups. We would like to invite you to apply even if you don't think you meet all of the requirements listed below. We don't want a few lines in a job description to get between us and the opportunity to meet you.

Original job Senior Technical Program Manager/ Business Systems posted on GrabJobs ©. To flag any issues with this job please use the Report Job button on GrabJobs.

title: Senior Technical Program Manager/ Business Systems

description:
The Meta Product TPM community is pioneering technologies to bring people closer together and our organization shares in the responsibility of doing it at global scale. As a Group Manager of Product Technical Program Management, you will be responsible for breaking complex initiatives down into prioritized and tangible programs, ensuring consistent flow of information and investment to key stakeholders.You will also be responsible for identifying and managing dependencies across the organization, finding long-term solutions to achieve high quality results for the initiatives. As a subject-matter expert, you will be responsible for driving and helping to scale product usage, seek to understand team dynamics, product ecosystem, and technical landscape while keeping the focus and accountability on delivery to ensure teams are making progress towards goals. You will be leading teams to drive strategy and execution in product areas, such as Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, Central Product Platform, Commerce Platform, Integrity, and Privacy as well as product platform areas that have specialized technical expertise, such as machine learning, ranking, APIs, and scaled infrastructure.We are looking for experienced technical leaders who can lead teams in complex, multi-platform development efforts at consumer scale while maintaining clarity of product vision and organizational awareness. This posting represents different full-time roles across the company, including Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, and other product areas.

Group Manager, Product Technical Program Management Responsibilities:
• Build, manage, and set direction for teams as a whole as well as for individual team member success.
• Identify and solve systemic, organizational-wide problems, influence, and build strong relationships. Partner with Product Management and Engineering to define needs to support strategic planning and execution as well as metrics, program requirements, and scope.
• As a cross-functional partner, lead technical discussions and be a thought leader during product reviews and be responsible for designing and executing process and strategy frameworks that facilitate product-related goal setting, decision making, and business impact.
• Articulate to stakeholders your team’s technology requirements, goals, and milestones.
• Integrate your technical knowledge, subject-matter expertise, and understanding of trends to make sound decisions and influence business direction through data-driven analysis.
• Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery.
• Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post-implementation phases.
• Perform risk and change management on projects.
• Influence program/product direction and simplify complexity.

Minimum Qualifications:
• B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience.
• 12+ years of software industry experience, including systems engineering, hardware engineering, or technical product/program management experience.
• 7+ years of people management experience leading teams to deliver technical programs or products from inception to delivery.
• Experience communicating and representing work to senior leadership and framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience working with technical management teams to develop systems, solutions, and products.
• Analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale systems.
• Experience establishing and leading teams through multi-disciplinary relationships, including product management and engineering to drive product impact.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with organizational design and building teams for scale.
• Experience managing managers.

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$195,000/year to $267,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

title: Group Manager, Product Technical Program Management

description:
The Technical Delivery Manager – Retail and Wholesale Supply Chain will report to the Senior Director, Go-To-Market Platforms and will be responsible for overseeing the entire technical delivery process of a project, ensuring that software or solutions are developed and delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. The role requires close collaboration with development teams, stakeholders, and other technical departments while utilizing agile methodologies to manage project planning, risk mitigation, and communication across all levels to achieve successful project outcomes. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, extensive experience managing complex projects, and a deep understanding of supply chain operations, including inventory management, logistics, procurement, and distribution systems.

CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES:
• Project Delivery & Execution:Develop comprehensive project plans, timelines, and resource allocations while managing scope, risks, and dependencies. Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of mid- to large-scale supply chain technology projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and budget.
• Stakeholder Management:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, IT teams, vendors, and third-party partners to align project objectives and deliverables. Communicate effectively with clients, product owners, and business stakeholders to translate technical concepts into understandable language.
• Technical Oversight & Leadership:Provide technical guidance and expertise to development teams, ensuring adherence to technical standards, architecture, and best practices. Review technical designs, code quality, and implementation plans while identifying and implementing technology improvements.
• Risk & Issue Management:Identify potential risks and issues early, develop mitigation strategies, and escalate when necessary to ensure project continuity.
• Agile Practices:Champion agile methodologies, facilitating ceremonies like daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives to drive continuous improvement in delivery processes and team performance.
• Budget & Vendor Management:Manage project budgets, forecasts, and resource allocations effectively. Oversee vendor relationships, including contract negotiations, performance tracking, and ensuring SLAs are met.
• Compliance & Governance:Ensure all projects adhere to compliance, security policies, and governance frameworks.
• Quality Assurance:Implement robust quality control measures, manage testing processes, and address identified defects to ensure high-quality deliverables.
• Team Collaboration & Mentorship:Foster a collaborative and productive working environment within the development team. Resolve technical issues and roadblocks effectively while mentoring and developing team members to promote continuous learning and improvement.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Supply Chain Management, or related field; Master's degree is a plus.
• 7+ years of experience in technical project or delivery management roles within retail, wholesale, or supply chain environments.
• Strong understanding of supply chain processes, including procurement, logistics, warehouse management, and order fulfillment.
• Proven experience in managing large-scale, cross-functional technology projects.
• Solid technical background with knowledge of enterprise systems (e.g., SAP S4 HANA, WMS) and integration technologies.
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and modern development practices (DevOps, CI/CD).
• Strong leadership, negotiation, and influencing skills.
• Excellent problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills under pressure.
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Certification in Project Management (PMP, PRINCE2) or Agile frameworks (Scrum Master, SAFe).
• Experience with SAP S4 HANA migration.
• Knowledge of Warehouse Operations, EDI standards, and Supply chain integrations.
• Experience with data analytics and reporting tools.
• Proficiency in Agile frameworks like Scrum, Kanban, and experience facilitating agile ceremonies.
• Ability to identify and resolve technical challenges effectively.
• Ability to work in fast-paced, dynamic environments with tight deadlines.
• Hybrid work environment with occasional travel to supply chain sites or vendor locations.

Base Salary: From $150,000 - $165,000 annually*

Bonus Eligibility: Yes, eligible for annual target bonus based on company and individual performance

Benefits Offered: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Care, Health Savings Accounts, 401(k) Retirement Plan, Vacation Time, Sick Time, Paid Parental Leave, Holidays and Cole Haan Discounts
• Rate of pay dependent upon candidates' relevant skills and experience

This position is not available to be performed in Colorado.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Cole Haan is committed to meeting the spirit as well as the letter of the law. We have been, and continue to be, committed to Equal Opportunity Employment and equal treatment of all qualified individuals - regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, or any other factors that are not job related.

description:
About Edia

Edia is a fast-growing Silicon Valley technology company that aims to reshape K-12 education. Today, Edia supports 100+ districts across the country (e.g. New York City, Miami, San Francisco, Fulton County, Denver, etc.) and builds breakthrough AI products to reduce chronic absenteeism, improve math outcomes, and more.

Overview

We're seeking a Technical Product Manager to lead our Revenue Operations function as we build a best-in-class Go-To-Market (GTM) organization across sales, customer success, and marketing. The ideal candidate thrives on solving complex business challenges with technology and AI. Your mandate will be to dramatically increase our GTM efficiency by working closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Engineering, and Leadership teams to optimize workflows, investigate key business questions, and enhance our tooling and systems.

Responsibilities
• Apply first-principles thinking to understand stakeholder needs across the organization, learning how SDR, AE, and CSM teams operate and developing innovative approaches to improve their functions
• Own and optimize the entire Revenue Operations technology stack, including CRM, marketing automation, data platforms, finance, and customer success platforms
• Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports providing real-time insights to GTM leadership, while analyzing metrics such as win rates, deal velocity, pipeline coverage, and customer engagement
• Automate and streamline workflows across marketing, sales, customer success, and finance systems to eliminate bottlenecks
• Demonstrate meticulous attention to detail and data integrity, ensuring all systems are accurate, up-to-date, and reliable
• Identify and troubleshoot GTM bottlenecks, surfacing opportunities for workflow automation or process improvements that reduce friction and accelerate revenue growth
• Build and deploy AI-powered solutions alongside Engineering to enhance forecasting, customer segmentation, health scoring, and operational efficiency

Qualifications
• Logical, first-principles thinker
• Experience with APIs, data pipelines, and workflow automation tools (Zapier, Make, n8n, Workato, etc.)
• Interest in (and experience with) AI-driven solutions, machine learning models, and LLM integration
• Technical proficiency: SQL, JavaScript and/or Python (Javascript preferred)
• Strong cross-functional communication skills to translate between technical and business stakeholders
• Demonstrated ability to own complex projects and drive them to completion

Additional Job Details

The expected salary and bonus range for this position is $130,000 – $200,000 annually. Compensation may vary based on qualifications, skills, and experience. Benefits include equity, flexible vacation (especially during school holiday periods), and a technology stipend.

This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the operational core of a 3x growth company, shaping processes that drive long-term success in K-12 education. Join us in building technology that makes a meaningful difference for students across America.

title: Technical Product Manager (Strategy & Operations)

description:
The Analytics & Data (A&D) team within Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Client Solutions Group owns all the management reporting, customer and product behavior insights, and predictive modeling in support of Wealth Management, Banking, and Firmwide Marketing. The team focuses on high-impact initiatives identified in partnership with senior executives and leaders throughout the firm. We are searching for an Assistant Vice President to join the Client Engagement Products team, as part of the A&D Strategy team.

The incumbent will be responsible for leveraging Morgan Stanley Wealth Management's data, analytics and machine learning capabilities to empower business critical use-cases across marketing, sales, servicing, advisory, and other. The ideal candidate would act as a product owner and business architect, perform extensive hands-on analysis, experimentations, evaluation, and testing to design new client engagement data products or new features/components for existing products, define detailed requirements, and drive the implementation. The candidate would have expertise in data wrangling and analysis, machine learning concepts, data organization/design, and architecting scalable solutions.

They must also possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills and be adept at collaborating with stakeholders across teams (especially with business partners and technology) to drive business outcomes. A primary focus of this role will be to oversee a program aimed at bringing the best-in class analytics and marketing practices to a unified, data driven Marketing orchestration platform working closely with WM Marketing, Machine Learning & Marketing Analytics teams. Responsibilities: Design, build, and manage state-of-the-art centralized client engagement products and capabilities leveraging data, analytics and AI, to drive critical business use-cases across marketing, sales, servicing, advisory, and more Perform advanced Analytics, including customer profiling, segmentation, and simulation of targeting and client reach of marketing products and solutions Own specific data products to create a unified customer experience between digital, relationship managers, and financial advisor channels Partner with business, Analytics, and machine learning teams to translate business needs to tech architecture and requirements, develop robust roadmaps, and partner with tech teams to build and test the solutions Enable the migration and consolidation of Morgan Stanley Wealth Management data products and analytics/ML use-cases on snowflake and cloud platforms Manage all aspects of products and solutions quality and integrity in partnership with compliance, governance, and technology teams Qualifications: Master's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Mathematics/Technology or similar At least 4 years of experience in Data, Analytics, or a related function SQL expert and preferred Python proficiency, hands-on experience with data analytics and insights generation, and advanced database knowledge and experience (e.g

RDBMS, Snowflake, Hadoop, Azure Data Lake Storage) High proficiency in Microsoft tools (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Problem solving skills - The candidate must be an independent thinker and demonstrate the ability to identify key issues, gather data to investigate those issues and develop actionable recommendations. Analytical skills - The candidate must be highly analytical with experience in defining analytical approaches for projects and applying a range of analytical tools to synthesize insights and develop solutions. They must be able to engage with data scientists and analysts.

Project management skills - The candidate must be able to scope and create workable project plans (experience with AGILE/SAFE is a plus).The candidate must be able to meet commitments and balance competing priorities Teamwork skills - The candidate must be flexible in their work style and be able to work collaboratively with others on the team Communications skills - The candidate must possess strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to quickly adjust messages and style based on different audiences and agendas Knowledge of Wealth Management concepts and investment strategies is a plus Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $100,000 and $135,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs. Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence

Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet). WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM MORGAN STANLEY: We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 85 years. At our foundation are five core values - putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back - that guide our more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries.

At Morgan Stanley, you'll find trusted colleagues, committed mentors and a culture that values diverse perspectives, individual intellect and cross-collaboration. We Firm is differentiated by the caliber of our diverse team. While our company culture and commitment to inclusion define our legacy and shape our future, helping to strengthen our business and bring value to clients around the world.

Learn more about how we put this commitment to action: morganstanley.com/diversity. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry. We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business

Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $100,000 and $135,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs. Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence.

Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. title: Analytics & Data, Client Engagement Products - AVP

description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.

At Snowflake, we're redefining what’s possible with data and AI. From our inception, we've been driven by a singular mission: to build a cloud data and AI platform that empowers every user with accessibility, affordability, and unmatched performance. With our unique architecture designed for the cloud from the ground up, Snowflake seamlessly blends the power of core data warehousing, native AI capabilities, privacy-preserving collaboration and the flexibility of the cloud—all at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions.

As the Senior Product Marketing Manager for Financial Services, you will be the strategic marketing lead driving positioning, messaging, marketing strategy, and growth initiatives for Snowflake’s offerings in this industry. You’ll be responsible for crafting and communicating compelling stories and driving innovative programs that illustrate how Snowflake’s AI Data Cloud empowers asset management, banking, insurance, and payments organizations, and the broader financial services ecosystem to solve their most critical business challenges.

AS A SENIOR PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER YOU WILL:
• Lead planning, objectives, and alignment across cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive execution of marketing strategies and initiatives that drive industry growth
• Develop and execute go-to-market strategies tailored to the financial services industry, including positioning, messaging, and differentiation strategies that align with market needs
• Create compelling and differentiated messaging, value propositions, thought leadership content, sales assets, customer stories, and industry-specific collateral to be used by Snowflake marketing and sales teams, as well as partner teams
• Work closely with the sales organization to drive use case implementation and product adoption through sales plays and enablement materials that empower sales teams to effectively engage and win in the market
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including go-to-market strategy teams, sales, demand generation, field marketing, ABM, content, and partner marketing, to align product marketing strategies and drive awareness and adoption within financial services.
• Establish Snowflake as a trusted thought leader in financial services data transformation through industry events, webinars, blogs, and customer advocacy initiatives
• Execute and be accountable for the success of go-to-market campaigns 
• Leverage data to identify opportunities, guide decisions, and measure performance of go-to-market activities
• Engage with customers, partners, and sales teams to gather insights and amplify Snowflake’s value proposition and messaging in the industry vertical.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
• 6+ years of experience in financial services product marketing or related experience; knowledge of asset management, banking, insurance and payments verticals is highly preferred
• Proven ability to create strategic marketing plans, including go-to-market strategies, positioning, and messaging tailored to complex, highly regulated industries
• Exceptional written communication skills and ability to synthesize complex information into clear and concise presentations and plans that resonates with executive-level audiences and technical audiences
• Strong leadership capabilities with experience in guiding cross-functional teams, influencing stakeholders, and driving projects to successful completion in a collaborative manner
• Ability to think big and re-imagine how Snowflake can deliver value to customers in collaboration with our partner ecosystem
• Passion for understanding customer needs and the ability to translate those needs into impactful marketing programs and initiatives
• BA/BS, MBA preferred

Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com

The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:
• The estimated base salary range for this role is $155,000 - $216,300.
• Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.

The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.

description:
Lead programs that deliver on critical business goals and build large scale products & platforms at Capital One. We innovate and inspire by leveraging best in class technology to develop the tools our customers need to improve their financial lives.
About This Role

This Senior Director of Technical Program Management role is part of our Associate Experience Technology team's Program Delivery Office (PDO). The PDO drives all intent for Associate Experiences highest priority initiatives as well as for critical techwide programs.
Your Responsibilities

You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to execute on key strategic programs. In addition to leading technical programs, you will also work to pave the way for an expanding TPM discipline within the team, by leveraging your industry knowledge and experience to teach the organization what a great TPM can achieve.
• Strong technical backgrounds with the ability to proactively identify and mitigate technical risks throughout delivery life-cycle
• Experience building and leading a world-class team of technical program managers
• Lead technology focused discussions with senior leadership by providing valuable insights and recommendations
• Exceptional communication and collaboration skills
• Excellent problem solving and influencing skills
• A quantitative approach to problem solving and a collaborative implementer to holistic solutions
• Experienced TPM leader to grow and develop a team of TPMs
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree and at least 9 years of experience managing technical programs.
Preferred Qualifications

9+ years of experience designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing, 5+ years of experience in building distributed systems & highly available services using cloud computing services / architecture, 5+ years of building & leading experienced TPM teams, and 5+ years of experience delivering large and complex programs.

description:
Our client is a leading reinsurance intermediary here in NYC. They offer accidents and health, agriculture, alternative risk transfer, general casualty, investment banking, life and annuity, marine and energy, professional liability, program manager solutions, property, retrocessional, structured risk, surety, terror risk, and workers compensation reinsurance products. Our client also provides client services, such as accounts, claims, contract wordings, and settlement. Due to company growth, they are seeking a Product Manager, Data Strategy to join their leading team here in NYC. This is a full-time role. This Product Management position will specialize in leading customer engagement, solution design, and project coordination for data products.

Job Title: Product Manager, Data Strategy

Location: New York, NY. (3x per week onsite)

Required Technology and Skills:
• 5+ years of product management or business analyst work experience in data products.
• Successfully led 3 + new products or product lines from inception to market with proven results.
• Must be able to conduct exploratory data analysis.
• Proficiency in Excel, SQL, API requests, and basic scripting in Python or R
• Strong understanding of modern data trends & principles (Machine Learning, AI, Natural Language) accompanying technology tooling ecosystem & vendor landscape. (Preferred)
• Experience working on a high-performing data team at a technology, consulting, or start-up company (Preferred)

Salary Range: Base salary range of $90,000 – $160,000+ a competitive bonus structure

Please apply directly for immediate consideration or reach out to Adam Deutsch @ adeutsch@talener.com

description:
Manager, Product Manager-Payments Intelligence

This role is for the Payments Intelligence team, within the Emerging Payments line of business at Capital One. The Payments Intelligence team builds at-scale data products (APIs, datasets) using a variety of cloud technologies and ML capabilities to power digital experiences and analytics across Capital One that need customer spend data.

Our data platform enables a diverse range of intents across various organizations, each with their own priorities. Our team powers a variety of marketed features and other internal capabilities.

As a Manager, Product Management, you will lead products within our platform that are responsible for the organization, enhancement and management of spend data, focused on maintaining high resilience, performance, and data quality.

In this role you will:
• Leverage strong analytical skills to manage and develop data products while executing a strategic product roadmap aligned with business goals.
• Collaborate across teams to define data-driven strategies, prioritize features, and deliver impactful solutions on time.
• Monitor product performance using key metrics, driving continuous improvement and innovation throughout the product lifecycle.

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you.

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered
• You will align product strategy around clear customer-backed themes and patterns to drive alignment between stakeholders
• You will lead a team in identifying and prioritizing roadmap founded in customer needs; recognizes when customer needs are not being met and advocates for evolving approach
• You will influence cross-organizational stakeholders to align on the right customer-focused solutions

Business Focused
• You will build product strategies and roadmaps for your areas independently, balancing priorities based on impact and risk
• You will understand and proactively address the cascading impacts of the roadmap inside and outside the organization, including broader business and enterprise context, financial impacts, and all facets of risk management
• You will identify opportunities to innovate for new sources of business value that can be supported by a platform, feature or capability

Technology Driven
• Inspires teams to deeply understand technology opportunities to increase velocity of new features and capabilities
• Fosters active partnership with architecture to drive target state; challenges existing principles to drive better macro outcomes
• Leads horizontally across the value chain to ensure effective monitoring and controls are in place

Transformational Leadership
• Defines an iterative vision backed product agenda that solves diverse customer problems and delivers business outcomes
• Works in multiple problem spaces and can appropriately prioritize problems / build a roadmap to maximize impact
• Articulates how products will interact with the larger product portfolio and business initiatives
• Leads with future focus and pushes back on narrow perspectives such as “it’s always been done that way”

What makes a great fit:
• Scaled Data Product experience [Ideal]- You understand and can access/analyze transaction data, and have experience and/or passion about building on cloud data technologies (DynamoDQ, streaming, data lakes).
• Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.
• Grit - You love starting from nothing. You know how to take on a challenge and find creative solutions to getting it done even when it's hard.Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.
• Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally a team to work with you.
• Continuous learner - Even if you don’t know the answer today, you are willing to learn the answer for tomorrow. You are not afraid to spend the day learning, asking questions, and digging deep.
• Best Partner - We do not expect you to be an expert at everything but we do expect you to know who to turn to for the right answer to the question

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree or military experience
• At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 1 years of experience in agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
• 1+ years of experience with Payments Industry (particularly transaction data) ideal
• 1+ years of experience with SQL, Databricks, data lakes, and/or AWS data services (DynamoDB, S3, streaming, etc)
• 5+ years of experience in Agile product management

Capital One will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.

The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.

New York, NY: $172,800 - $197,200 for Manager, Product Management

Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate’s offer letter.

This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan.

Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.

This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.

No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender reassignment, citizenship, immigration status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.

All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com
